website_summaries.verdict: A great value for owners of smaller dogs as it has a weight capacity of just 40 pounds.
pros: It's so lightweight and designed so well, you won't even really notice you're towing something
Perfect for those dog parents who love biking but hate leaving their little friend at home
cons: Intended for bicycles with 26-inch wheels or smaller

customer_reviews.title: We Luv This!
customer_reviews.text: We love this! Took it on two vacations & use weekly on trails at home. A bonus, when your 3 yr old gets tired from riding, you can strap him next to your 1 yr old & put his bike in the rear cargo area. '
customer_reviews.author: Sara Uchytil

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous buckle/strap system.
customer_reviews.text: This product is dangerous. I wish I could return it but already had it for a few months. It is all good unless it flips on the side, which it will easily do if you break and the rear wheel of the bike slides on a downhill. The problem is not as much the flipping as the buckle system. The buckles are tied to a solid area like the frame. They are stitched to the seating fabric. In case of a tilt/flip they fail to secure the child enough to prevent sliding beyond the frame of the carriage! Also on a couple occasions the cheap plastic buckle has come undone for no apparent reason other than being very flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: AZ MTBer

customer_reviews.title: Love this nice wagon
customer_reviews.text: Love this nice wagon. Got it so i can take my kids with me while I exercise and I couldn't be happier. So far we have only had it close to a month but I have taken it out a few times and no complaints. Both kids were able to fit inside the cart. My son is 7 and is a little bit over 4ft and weighs just over 50lb. Though he fits he's definitely a year away from being too big. Plus lugging that around is hard. My daughter who is 4 and just a little smaller fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Rachaelrrr

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit all bike models!
customer_reviews.text: First, the quality of this product is fine and the seller delivered as promised, this is not a critique for that. The problem is my husband and I have very high end bikes, a Specialized and a Trek, and this product is not made for these types of bikes. We missed the 30 day return policy date and ended up having to rent one. Thuley makes the model that will fit our bikes. If you have one of the bikes it does fit it’s a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this trailer - straps disintegrate after 2 years - UNSAFE PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: We used this trailer 3 times when we purchased new from Amazon it and we enjoyed it. It was stored in our garage. We decided to use is again after 1.5 years of storage and we discovered all of the safety straps on the seat harness had disintegrated. I have attached photos of the shredded straps. These are obviously very low quality straps and are meant to keep your child in place. I can tear them with my bare hands as they are obviously defective and unsafe. I would not recommend this trailer since its is not durable and is unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: mike hack

customer_reviews.title: Great for some family fun
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! So glad I got the single, it's super easy to tow I can barely tell it is there. It also fits my 18 month old very comfortably. I gave it 4 stars only because it came with a small tear in the back but we are going camping this weekend so no time to return it over a small defect.
customer_reviews.author: ATL

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! My son loves this!
customer_reviews.text: We love this thing! You can even buy a conversion kit so you can turn it into a travel stroller. We lock up the bikes and go walk wherever we've driven to all the time. Highly recommend for younger babies. We started putting my son in at about 6 months/16 lbs, and he loves it. I imagine we will get use out if it until he is about 30lbs. I don't know that I'd recommend going over that even if the product says it's ok. Take it from someone who uses this several times a week.
customer_reviews.author: A. Silvestri

customer_reviews.title: Good Cheap Trailer, Hard to Haul Evertyhing
customer_reviews.text: For a non-pedaling 4 year old, no complaints about quality, but the size is really a challenge. The child area and the cargo area are really competing for space. After we load the bicycle tool bag, diaper backpack, snacks-and-drinks bag, and picnic blanket, the child is really having his space encroached by the stuff behind him. If we add a picnic lunch bag, then things are really too full! On the bright side, the hitch system seems good and secure, the tires and wheels are good quality. It took a 10 year old 10 minutes to figure out how to mount the flag but then it was good. It folds up nicely when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Sweaty Elvis

customer_reviews.title: The wheels tire valves are of such a poor quality that I was never be able to inflate ...
customer_reviews.text: The wheels tire valves are of such a poor quality that I was never be able to inflate them appropriately. I bought the double bicycle for my daughter and we used it just 5 times, this past Sunday I tried to use it again but I realized the valve of one wheel had fallen, and the valve on the other wheel was laying against the wheel...well it has been like that forever. In conclusion if the wheels don not work the bicycle is worthless. Pretty disappointed I would have preferred to invest more money in a better-quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly Wheel. Doesn't look Safe.
customer_reviews.text: I assembled the trailer today. Upon riding it for the first time, I noticed the right wheel is wobbly and looks unsafe. Although my ride today was fine, I'm uncertain of the longevity of this wheel or product. I'm afraid of putting my child in the seat in fear of the wheel falling out or breaking. I have included a video of the wobbly wheel. Even though I checked that the wheel is properly attached, (listened for the click and tried pulling on it according to the manual), it doesn't seem to create a tight fit and the looseness of it might be causing the wobble. My wheel and/or trailer may be defective.
customer_reviews.author: Danny W.

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: We picked this up so our family can go on more bike rides while our little guy is not ready to ride on his own. I was a little hesitant to purchase one of these used in case we had a fit issue(going on a 29er) but so far no issues. Hardware lines up properly and there is more than enough space for the largest of bikes and tires. I wish I would have picked up the double as my big guy is totally jealous that he can't kick back and relax.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn U.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: My husband put it together and had no complaints about it. I am able to easily attach the cart to my bike, lock it with its pin, and us the safety strap with ease. My husband did have to remove my kickstand to attach it so I need another adult with me to hold the bike while I get my toddler into the cart safely. (Need to look into kickstand to work with the cart) My toddler enjoys riding in this and loves that no bugs and get on him!
customer_reviews.author: Cici

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: Our little dude LOVES riding in this. It's pretty good quality for the price. I have two concerns that may cause me to spring for a more high quality brand: 1. The bottom is the same material as sides, so his little bottom dips down rather then sitting on something sturdy/flat. 2. The wheels feel a bit shaky at times - definitely for use on trails/flat surfaces, not bumpy trails or roads. (which wouldn't be comfortable for the kid anyways).
customer_reviews.author: Mallori

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my 18 month old son and my 3 year old daughter. I love that there is room for both of them (my son is literally the size of a 3 year old, even bigger than his older sister) so it can fit two three year olds perfectly. I love that they both get strapped in, and if only one of them choose to ride, there is a spot in the middle complete with straps so they don’t have to sit off to one side. It even has a tiny trunk, big enough to fit your lunch, water bottles, jackets, or even a thin picnic blanket.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Lazaro

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: It was comparatively easy to assemble, folding it is not something that you want to do every day. Easy but have a lot of pieces you need to make sure are carefully taken out. After a few times, you will get used to it. my 2 years old sit in the middle properly and have enough legroom. The floor of the seating area is just fabric I mean it doesn't have any hard or sturdy so for kids it feels like sagging but they enjoy it and have fun especially when just secure them with netting to get all the breeze while riding. Have enough space at the back to stack snacks while on a bike ride for breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Rehan K

customer_reviews.title: Bought used and its damaged
customer_reviews.text: I brought this used from Amazon warehouse. It came with everything to assemble except the coupler that attaches to the bike. I had to order that later by itself. The product said good condition, however there was a rip in the front right corner of the main fabric shell. Plus the snap button on the same front right side is messed up to the point I will have to replace it. I feel the used price wasn't much of a discount for this "good condition" trailer. I have made it work but wish it would have been checked and included in the price and description of the flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: No leg room and no seat support.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a bike trailer and this did the job. It was hard to find anything in stock so this was my only option. Easy to setup and fold. 2 Big issues i have is that there is no support for child to sit on. Our child is pretty much sitting on the material which sags to the floor. Secondly, my 2yr old has to crunch up her legs to sit inside due to the poor leg room space. In the future I would look for a more spacious trailer and one that has a seat support. Lastly, I learned later that plastic rim tires are poorer quality as compared to tires with metal rims.
customer_reviews.author: Tahoesnow

customer_reviews.title: So far we love this little trailer
customer_reviews.text: So far we love this little trailer. We didn't need some fancy expensive one because we use ours around our neighborhood. I'm not some professional cyclist and I don't do anything crazy. What I can say is that this is perfect for what we need. It is sturdy and very roomy for our 1 year old. I was even surprised to see there is room in the back for a tote or a backpack. It was easy to put together and attach to my bike. Our daughter has fun in it.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzo82

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Package was not concealed. So anyone could of stolen it cause it came in original box. But all material is of quality . Very easy to assemble. I watched a YouTube video to figure out how to connect to bike. I'm a visual learner. It bears reading instructions. Daughter loves it. We go for a ride tomorrow. I will update. Only this I didnt like is that the floor of trailer is fabric. It should have better flooring for the kids to sit on. Just dont ride over nothing that could splash up or scrap bottom of trailer cause they he will feel it.
customer_reviews.author: Kay young

customer_reviews.title: Worst trailer ever
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of crap! It's horrible - do NOT buy one! Our wheels kept warping (no matter where we put it - garage, inside the house, close to the AC) and had to have each wheel replaced a total of 4 times!! One of the snaps broke within the first 6 months of owning it and the Velcro starting coming off the trailer the last 6 months. Save your money and buy an actual legit, great one (Burley)
customer_reviews.author: J. Hornberger

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We only have one child and he's only 1, so I can't really comment on multi child use or good legroom for an older child, but for us this is perfect! It was so easy to set up and so easy to attach and detach to the bike. For LO there's a lot of room for his toys and a nice cozy blanket (in early spring and likely late fall). There's enough space at the back for his diaper bag which is SO convenient! Husband was worried about getting a "cheaper" brand stroller, but this is perfect! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Unusable after replacing tire tubes.
customer_reviews.text: We used the trailer for about a week with our preschoolers, on nightly rides on an asphalt-paved river walk trail. After the sixth or seventh use, we saw the tires had gone flat and upon inspection, the tubes had large slits but the tires were undamaged. We bought replacement tubes but after installing the tubes, a rim of the wheel completely disconnected from the wheel assembly, rendering the wheel and trailer unusable, and the replacement tube popped. While it was comfortable for the initial rides, I would not recommend purchasing the trailer if the wheels fall apart with the first change of tubes.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Bike Trailer
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this trailer for a few months now, and it is fantastic! It has all the features I was looking for: Collapsible, so I can put it inside the car, A storage space behind the baby, Good ventilation Protection from the rain Comfortable ride for the baby Easy for me to pull Quick connect/disconnect Very sturdy, week-made. All this, and affordable. After reading other reviews where people had tire trouble, I noticed when I got my trailer, the tires seemed partially inflated, like they could maybe use more air. I left them like that. I've never added air, and never had a problem. I'm so happy with this bike trailer!
customer_reviews.author: A.Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this about a year ago and it's still going strong. We use it quite a bit. Our daughter loves to ride in this trailer. We use it with 26" tires and it works fine. I'm not sure what people were talking about when they said it won't fit bigger tires. There's no way it'll just 'tip', it has a metal bar connecting the trailer to the bike, so unless the bike goes down, then so will the trailer, but the trailer itself won't just 'fall over'. I love the extra storage space in the back, too. Great trailer!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Good product, a few tweaks would make it great!
customer_reviews.text: My kid and I love this thing. We have put over 80 miles on it and it still holds strong. The only downsides are the seating, there is no padding at all. This was an easy fix by stuffing a small pillow underneath. The other downside is the lack of cup holders. This was remedied by adding one we purchased for the stroller we no longer use. Lastly, the side windows do not transform to the mesh, like the front and back windows. Not a game changer, but on hot days, that would be a nice touch. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Blumski33

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. It fits two kids (3.5 year old and 18 month old) well, though of course they sometimes have personal space issues but mostly fine since they spend the time looking outside as we travel. It doesn't seem to restrict my ability to turn either. It folds up pretty easily, just a little stiffness unfastening the top bar but not too bad. The only downside is that the instructions for installing the connector on my bike don't seem to account for having a quick release on the back axel, so I had to rearrange some things to figure it out on my own.
customer_reviews.author: Everett

customer_reviews.title: this is great!
customer_reviews.text: It came in a nice small box, and I was waiting to have to REALLY assemble this thing! But, pleasantly, it's 99% assembled, and folded in thirds, so you just have to unfold it. Very nice. Wheels just click into place. The part that attaches to my bicycle attaches easily. Got it for 16-month old twins, and they love it! The only casualty was the red reflector on the back was cracked, but they have very good customer service email / phone / website in their user's manual. For the price, this is fabulous
customer_reviews.author: Blitz

customer_reviews.title: Why pay more when you can pay LESS??
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver for riding around with my 1.5 year old daughter and keeping up with 3 older brothers. There is plenty of room in the seat...I can imagine my daughter being comfortable in there for years to come. The cargo/storage area behind the seat is bigger than expected. I can fit a decent size cooler bag and diapers/wipes with room to spare. My husband and I are able to easily move the trailer between our bikes with an extra adaptor we bought.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Vollmer

customer_reviews.title: So convenient and fun!
customer_reviews.text: We used it with our 1 year old, and she loved it! I likes that she could see everything while being secured with straps. It has a pocket on the inside where can put a toy which was a nice detail. It is super easy to fold and pop back up again. One thing I did not like is that I noticed if we went through dirt, it would splatter on to her! That's not Instep's fault though, I just recommend buying the accessory for your bikes to prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia

customer_reviews.title: I bought this here for $70 a month ago!
customer_reviews.text: This works really great. My 2 year old loves it, and I make sure she wears a helmet when riding. Turns well with the bike (Huffy cruiser), but the only thing I'm uncomfortable with is not being able to see her behind me as I ride -- something to consider if you want to buy this. ALSO, I'm very surprised this is currently listed for $130 as I purchased brand new in March for $70. Prospective buyers may want to price watch and see if it goes down again?
customer_reviews.author: wbslayer83

customer_reviews.title: Great option for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, comfortable ride for the kids, and a great price. Good amount of storage behind the seats too. We use it for a a 5 and 2.5 year old currently. I've only used it with the plastic cover rolled up once and never again, kids had extremely dirty faces! Dirt you don't realize is even on the road ends up inside the trailer so beware! No way around it, not the fault of the product, just a heads up to other parents. We love biking as a family!
customer_reviews.author: Story Collector

customer_reviews.title: Great seat! Easy to pull
customer_reviews.text: Great seat! Easy to pull. It's a pretty bumpy ride for the little one, so I wouldn't recommend this for avid off road bikers. More for a casual ride around the neighborhood, which is what we use it for. The seat inside doesn't seem very comfortable. It sits straight up. My little one tolerates it for a bit, but gets uncomfortable after awhile. Haven't figured out the best solution. Overall, for the price, it works. If you're riding long distance or anything more than to get outside for a bit, I would suggest spending more money on better quality. This is a very basic trailer
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Weemhoff

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate safety belt
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was simple. A little tricky trying to hook it up to the bike. Biggest complaint is the belts are too small...barely fits around my underweight child. I used it to have my child and her normal weight friend since it's a 2 person...both are well under 40lbs. Friend's belt did not close, was too tight on one side and the other did not reach the buckle. Too bad return window closed before I got to try it due to Covid19 stay at home! Seller, if you are reading this....I want to give it back because it doesn't safely fit the kids!!!
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Although expensive but it works
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something spacious and practical for my 1.5 year old son. Putting it together was a breeze not to mention the adapter that attaches to the actual bike. The harness in the trailer seems a bit odd as it does need some readjusting. The tires are great as I’ve taken it through some rough terrain and no stress was seen. Overall, it’s expensive and the weight limit sucks (40lbs max). My son can ride it in for a couple more months. Until then, I’ll enjoy it as it is not heavy whatsoever to pull and runs great.
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this bike trailer! It fits my tall toddler perfectly and he loves it! Super easy to assemble! We have been traveling with it a ton because it takes less than 5 minutes to unload, set up and attach back onto our bike and it lays flat in the car! The initial set up only took about 15 minutes too! Super cute and has room for snacks, blankets, and water bottles behind the seats! All of this for SUCH a good price! 10/10 recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Brogly

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good -- tires get flat easily
customer_reviews.text: My three-year-old loves to ride in this trailer. It is pretty easy to set up and fold down for storage. Parts are kind of plasticky, but I imagine we will only be using it for another year or so. I'm not sure if it's specific to this trailer as I haven't used any others, but it is very easy to pull, doesn't add a lot of difficulty to the bike ride. Tires do tend to go flat pretty quickly, but I just pump them up again.
customer_reviews.author: MontanaReader

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, just a little smaller than expected in the seats
customer_reviews.text: This bike trailer is awesome. The only thing I don’t like is that it isn’t much room for 2 kids, it’s more so a spacious seat for 1. The canopy could’ve been attached instead of removable because it’s hard to put on and take off and that’s the only way in/out. Other than that it’s a great little bike trailer. Works great, the kids love it and it’s nice and sturdy and has plenty of storage spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Ables

customer_reviews.title: Missing Piece and Instruction manual
customer_reviews.text: My main issue was they didn't send the piece that you attach to the bike, also had no instructions. Made me think this was a return by someone else and forgot to replace those items. Don't really need instructions as it's simple assemble, but had to pay $10 for the piece. I called their customer service, machine said to send email. Decided by the time I got a response I would already have the piece I needed. Other than this experience it's been a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Good with some cons
customer_reviews.text: Decent trailer at this price range. Few cons: 1.The fabric at foot well is thinner than other parts, you can see the little holes. Some plastic frame covers are not properly installed. 2.Some bolts need to be adjusted, some of them are a little loose some over tighten. 3.Only one bar with plastic parts at each end Support the upper frame. It doesn’t seem to be very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great value for your money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike trailer for the price!! The straps are adjustable for different heightened children. Very easy to assemble and to get the kids in. Nice little cargo area in the back. Easy to connect to bike. The only thing that would make it better is a zipper to get your kids out. Its velcro at the bottom and pretty loud . My sleepy kids can sleep through the noise but some may not.
customer_reviews.author: sa

customer_reviews.title: Good accessories to have your little enjoy a bike ride with you
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, Pretty good leg room and good storage space behind the seat. Only concern is that when there are long bike rides with your little one in the back, the baby tends to fall asleep and can be quite uncomfortable for them to fall asleep with their heads hanging down. I would have loved it if part of the design gave you the option to slant the child's seat back. So the child can sleep in a more comfortable position while you continue to ride.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Reyes

customer_reviews.title: A great little bike trailer
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a bike trailer that would be easy to modify to be right-side mounted to my electric scooter, and this trailer was that. The trailer arm was easily removed, flipped, and bolted to the other side. I only had to drill two holes. The large pneumatic tires provide a smooth ride, and my 2-year-old loves his scooter rides during the lock down.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisGeek

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is so well made, assembly & disassembly was piece of cake, looks very sturdy. Like the back space for carrying extra items, have not used yet and I can't wait to take it out for a bike ride with my little one in the back. My bike wheels are 700 mm (27 in+) and it fits and adjusts perfect, plenty of space between the rear bike tire and the trailer and it holds up just right! One comment I have is it would be nice to have a strap across for when the trailer is folded to hold it in place, & carry.
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but seat uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Overall, really good trailer for price. My only qualm is that the sling seat (I wish it was more of a regular seat, however) is very straight so when my son wears his helmet in it, he tends to almost seem too far forward/slouched and uncomfortable. I wish the seat had a recline optiom or be a bit more angled so that it's more comfortable for riding. No way do I see my son falling asleep in this with how the seat is. But otherwise, good storage, good legroom, easy to assemble and attach to bike, and overall good quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fur kids too!
customer_reviews.text: Let’s be honest, I bought this entirely for my dog. No intention of ever having a human child in it. And I love it! The seat has buckles underneath it -I unclipped those and removed it. Using the loops that had been for holding in the seat I popped in a leash for a makeshift seatbelt/restraint. Now it’s a nice and open doggy trailer! Easy to fold and unfold. Light enough to easily carry in and out of the building. And my dog settled right into it! We only took it for a few mile test ride tonight, but I hardly even noticed I was pulling 30lbs of dog behind me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Fit ALL bikes and tire popped after first ride.
customer_reviews.text: First problem: the provided bike couple requires a large flat surface where it connects to the bike. It took some improvising to make it sorta work on my Scott mountain bike. It would be helpful if InStep would provide adapter kits for their trailers instead of saying their product fits all bikes. Lame. 2nd problem: I loaded my two little girls(2 and 4) into the trailer and took them on a 10 minute ride and while sitting in my driveway after the short test ride, the right tire popped! How does that even happen? I inflated to the recommended 35 psi and did everything the instructions said. Fail.
customer_reviews.author: Urban Okie

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Option
customer_reviews.text: We got this to take our toddler biking with us. Super easy to put together with lots of mesh for good ventilation. We read a lot of the reviews before purchasing and kept in mind one that said it doesn’t have shocks so it can get a bit rough. We only bike on the street so this hasn’t been a problem and if there is a dip we slow down for her. Overall a great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa J

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, equivalent to Burley Brand
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great purchase! We used to have a double burley trailer, but got rid of it because it was old and bulky. This In Step trailer has been a great replacement. Its for a single rider, compact and works great. I would only say if you plan on doing a lot of biking, or riding on dirt paths, the wheels aren't as durable as the burley wheels. But for riding on sidewalks/streets this trailer works perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Tires
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend buying this product. At first it did seem like a great product but I had the worst troubles with the tires. It was easy to assemble, but didn’t have much leg room. The tires would not blow up. We tried five different air pumps, and at first thought it was the air pump but it was the tires. They were very bad quality. I called the customer service and the lady was very rude to me and questioned me if I knew how to blow up a tire and I do. They sent me one tire and it didn’t not work either. This product was returned and the tires were terrible quality.
customer_reviews.author: leslie fisken

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cart for my 3 year granddaughter to ride in when she visits grandma and grandpa. It was easy to assemble, easy to attach to the bike and the color is great. Like that it has adjustable flaps to let in a nice airflow but provides protection from road debris. The size is a bit smaller than we had hoped, however. Our granddaughter fits nicely in it now, but will likely outgrow it by next summer. Also, she did complain that the bar under the canvas seat area was hurting her behind. We added a thick beach towel for her to sit on and that solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: MKC

customer_reviews.title: Bottom could be more secure. Other than that it rides nicely!
customer_reviews.text: Product is great and rides very nicely but I have one complaint: the bottom of the carrier is not so secure. The seat eventually sags from use and it’s a little concerning because you wonder weather or not your child will fall through it. The carrier should have a piece of plastic or thick straps underneath to make certain your child is safe!
customer_reviews.author: Noura

customer_reviews.title: MUST PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh this is the best thing everrr!! So comfy for our 2 year old daughter. The straps and seat belt are amazing. Got caught in a rain storm and she stayed dry the whole time with the rain shield down. Room for her snacks, her dinasour dory to go with along with her water. SUPER easy to attach and detach from bike. All around a must purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ayla

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cart
customer_reviews.text: This cart is just what we needed. Enough room for our 10 month old and now 2 year old. Storage in the back behind seat for diaper bag, food, drinks, etc. Rides very smooth. Easy to assemble and hook up. Great customer service! Highly recommend this company and this cart.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Easy and compact for one child
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fold down into a more compact bundle for storage and transport. We easily fit our in the back of a four runner. Not as big as I expected but it’s fone for now because our daughter is only two. I can’t see her using this much past next year. It’s easy to assemble out of the box. Ours arrived three days late and was pretty beat up on the outside but it seems to be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Radical Reebs

customer_reviews.title: As advertised. This buggy is nice.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice unit. Two spots for the kids. My taller (5yo) doesn’t like riding in it because of lack of head room. But she is tall and prefers the tag along bike. But my smaller kids enjoy it. It installs easy. I bought a couple more mike connections for it. I pull it behind the tag along bike mostly. Flag helps with visibility. I like the option to close the plastic for cooler days. My 18 month old loves the snack pouches.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony BC83

customer_reviews.title: Great for leisure bike riding with your children!
customer_reviews.text: Using this product to tow a 2 year old and 10 month old. Easy to set up (less than 10 minutes) and easy to put children in and take out! It it’s safe and durable as well. It has a nice protective rain cover as well. I was worried they would get too hot inside, but there’s lots of air pockets and ventilation. I recommend this to any leisure biking parent!
customer_reviews.author: Carly D.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy but not too good for 2 kids together who are slightly more than 30 lbs.
customer_reviews.text: Its a great trailer, but the information reported is incorrect, it says "Coupler attaches to almost any bicycle; includes stroller kit with swiveling front wheel and handlebar" but the stroller kit doesnt come with it. also the quality is good but doesnt look too duarable . i put my twin daugthers in, both weigh around 35 lbs, and they seemed to be uncomfortable. great for the price easiest to assemble , disassemble , store in the garage like any other strollers it takes very less space because it can fold easily over all fun and great if you still have smaller kids. i will end up returning it
customer_reviews.author: Ausaf W. Masud

customer_reviews.title: Works Great For My 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to assemble, didn't even need to use directions. Seems sturdy and safe. My 2 year old fits perfectly in there and she doesnt mind bumpy roads or when I go fast. Nothing there for cushion but it doesnt seem to bother my kid. I like the additional storage area in the back and I like how narrow the single seater is. When im riding, the width is almost the same as my frame, so i can make it through narrow spots without worrying if the trailer is going to get knocked around. Plus theres two screens. One that lets the air really flow through and the other that seems waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: csmall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cost efficient trailer for a fun family day
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set up (5 min out of the box). Excellent cost efficient kid-trailer for a fun day out with the family (Triathletes may want to look elsewhere). Good construction (one caveat: the side panels would have been better designed with a mesh option rather than plastic, perhaps less air flow in favor of splash-proof) and decent storage space. Overall amust buy for the price and fun. Fully recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Cronyn

customer_reviews.title: Ok buy...
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money. There are two things that I really don’t like about it though: to get in and out, you have to completely undo the snaps and velcro (it would be so much nicer if there were a smaller door/zipper that could be used). Also, the buckles snap REALLY low—almost under the child’s bottom (and for little boys, it presses on the family jewels...) It’s really narrow as well, so I don’t recommend putting two kids over 3 together, or even just one kid over 4ish. It is, however, REALLY easy to put together :)
customer_reviews.author: JGourlay

customer_reviews.title: Not a lot of legroom
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 3 year old daughter until she is more comfortable on her bike with training wheels. It is very easy to put together and store. It comes with an attachment that goes into an adult bike so the trailer can attach easily. The only issue is that there isn’t a lot of legroom for a 3 year old or a child with longer legs.
customer_reviews.author: ACP

customer_reviews.title: It’s great but awkward with just one kid.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS. We bought this to go on bike rides with our son (bought the two seater for future sibling) it Was super easy to assemble and the ride is pretty smooth. The only thing I would say is that if you only have one child with you it’s kinda an awkward sit for them in the middle. My sons helmet pushes his head down because of a bar there and makes it to where he can’t see and he cries.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised at how easy it was to put together
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how easy it was to put together. I put this AND a bike together in under 30 minutes. You basically just unfold this thing and you are on your way. We use it for just slowly cruising the neighborhood to get ice cream the such. Feels sturdy enough for that. The only thing i could say i wish was better is how the velcro connects after you put your child in. Kind of a pain to get a good "seal" but other than that it meets all my expectations for the price i paid for it
customer_reviews.author: John Baumgartner

customer_reviews.title: Nice little ride for little riders!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the double trailer. My toddlers (1 & 3 yo) love going on bike rides. There’s plenty of leg room for them and even more room for the stuffed animals and toys they bring along. The reason for 4 stars? There is no recline. My youngest seems to fall asleep while riding and her little head just bobs. Other than that, it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Tires didn’t even last the first and only ride
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Easy to assemble and fold back up. Easy to attach to bike. Big enough for 3 year old and 1 year old. Little storage space in the back too. CONS: The reason I’m giving it 2 stars is because opened and assembled the day it was delivered to take it for a quick ride around the neighborhood. Rode it once and one of the tires deflated. Tried refilling with air but it won’t stay inflated. Disappointed to spend $145 on junk bike trailer. Tried reaching out to company but no responses.
customer_reviews.author: Chad L.

customer_reviews.title: Should have been a one seater
customer_reviews.text: Both of my kids 3 and 2 said it was uncomfortable and only wanted to go around the neighborhood once. They love my old one but I bent a rim and can’t remember what kind it was. It is years old. Looks like I’ll have to find a new rim for the other and give this one to my neighbor and hope his little ones will fit.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Works with a 2.5 yr old and a 1yr old
customer_reviews.text: Was super easy to assemble. We have about 26miles on it with both kids sitting in it. They are very close together though. Even got a splash of rain which the rain cover took care of, they loved that when it happened. Was a little concerned about the plastic wheels, but so far they haven't been a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: Seat is not that comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The design is very nice. i don't like two things about this product: the seat is not that comfortable ( my daughter did not want to sit in it) and the mesh in the front is not that great because when you ride a bike all the dust flies right into the baby's face. There should be little better design with that window and maybe to have plastic cover from the bottom half and mesh on the top half and on the sides for good ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Petra Blasko

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It rides fine, the front cover is a little tough to pull down and snap/velcro evenly. Update: don't leave it out in the sun for too many days(whoops), the scraps turned into dust in my hands after leaving it out in the heat for about 3 months. I purchased new covers from the supplier. I now pull the wheels off and collapse it and store it in the closet. I don't realize it was collapsible, great feature. I changed my rating to 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Javier Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Overall good...but
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great bike trailer. One component that should be improved however, is the rain guard lining. The first day we received the trailer 5/27/20 we went for a bike ride. We ended up getting caught in rain which is when we noticed our son was soaked from the rain. The clear, plastic guard should go back farther.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Love it but...
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my baby was looking for something so she could enjoy it also the only thing is the tires came on flat I tried pumping but didn’t work even tried to order new inner tubes but they are small so couldn’t find I reached out to instep but they never responded besides the fact that they received my email
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should.
customer_reviews.text: For this price, this thing is pretty good. It doesn't what it's supposed to do. I do wish the "floor" of it wasn't so thin. I'm afraid it'll rip one of these days and down goes my tot. A lot of the reviews claimed the tires were cheap. We live on a dirt road and haven't had any issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kyndra

customer_reviews.title: Get it!  Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, easy to put to gather and to transfer from one bike to another bike. My son loves it! It is great for stocking with supplies ! It has a plastic "shield" that comes down in front, I would recommend keeping it down, because if you happen to ride over anything, it keeps it whatever from getting on your child/ or the inside of the cart.
customer_reviews.author: Taunchie

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to tow our aging miniature Labradoodle along on our bike rides. Can't say enough good about it. Takes all of about one minute to either fold up or set up from being folded. When folded up, it's about 18" x 40" and stores easily anywhere you want to put it. Excellent quality and very sturdy. We've put a lot of miles on it already with no issues. Buy one!
customer_reviews.author: David Bullard

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough for two children
customer_reviews.text: The product was not strong enough for two children. Not enough support in the bottom of the carrier. Children rolled into the middle and were on top of each other.
customer_reviews.author: gloria j. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Solid winner at this price point
customer_reviews.text: This is the second InStep trailer we have purchased, the other one a single model. Setup was easy and fast. The double model is very wide, easily fits a 1 year old and a 4 year old. The seat is pretty basic, the lack of suspension makes rides a little rough when you hit the bumps, but at this price range we love these. Sure like others point out, debris from the bike tire could kick up onto the trailer, but I'm not sure minus fully covering up the front how you avoid that on any trailer. Easy to pull behind a mountain bike, solid construction. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Hokie115

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy, safe
customer_reviews.text: This trailer is awesome! I ordered it because my wife and I loved to bike before our daughter was born and we wanted to get back into riding. This little trailer blew me away! For $110 I’m impressed! The assembly was a breeze, I set it up in 20 mins after work. It’s sturdy, and I’m really confident in its safety. Great purchase, I’d buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: CMojica

customer_reviews.title: Dog Trailer
customer_reviews.text: Makes a good dog carrier with some mods. We have 2 small dogs (16# & 10#) and both fit nicely. Cut a 1/2" piece of play wood to 31x23" drill 4 holes and add some button dowels to hold it place and it works great. On some bumps the plywood may bounce a little so you may want to secure it to the frame...but to keep it fold-able I believe the plywood has to come out. The main hassle was removing the child seats/harnesses. There also was a comment about it not fitting Giant bikes. I have a Giant Iguana (the bike, that is) and it works/installs fine.
customer_reviews.author: S. M.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and easy to pull
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and easy to pull. Just make sure you tighten the tire on your bike enough! I had a nice ride down the hill then attempted to peddle and had a not so fun dragging my bike trailer and son up the hill. May also be good to keep a few bike tools/tire pump behind where the kid sits.
customer_reviews.author: Lilli Casey

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The baby loves it and I feel safe putting him into it. The seat has no adjustment but I don't think you really want the baby to recline. We just weren't sure at first so I wanted to mention it. Very smooth and the baby often falls asleep but when he's awake he loves the near panoramic view he has.
customer_reviews.author: P.C.S.

customer_reviews.title: Folding
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of this trailer I would have posted a picture but I am still trying to get it attached to my bike my screws are stuck. My toddler instantly went into it and loves it once it was put together. I am still working on folding it doesn’t seem as easy as instructed.
customer_reviews.author: Deniqua Belcher

customer_reviews.title: BUY THE CORRECT EXTRA COUPLING!!
customer_reviews.text: We love the trailer! it fits our 25lb child great, rolls easily, was easy to put together. It's not going to carry 400lb of rocks, but seems like 1-2 kids should be great. BUT MAKE SURE YOU BUY THE CORRECT COUPLING IF PURCHASING AN EXTRA!!! Apparently there is a new version, and after some date, the coupling mechanism is different. Make sure to purchase this one or you will be out of luck (like me). This is the new version
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2015, used maybe twice, it’s been kept in the garage this whole time. I gave It to a friend and the whole harness fell apart in her hands!!! So they’re is nothing to keep the baby safely in the cart. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Howard

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing we could have purchased for our little family. Our 2 year old absolutely loves going for a ride in “her bike”. It is extremely sturdy, easy to assemble and doesn’t fall over if and when the bike does. Would recommend this to anyone with small children!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Actually fits 2 kids.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second trailer I bought because the Allen Sports Deluxe 2-child bike trailer did not actually fit two children comfortably. This one is a bit larger and had plenty of legroom for my two year old and her big brother who is almost 4. They had a great time on our night ride and it was easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Naeera

customer_reviews.title: Squishy for 2 kids
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 2.5 year old so it can grow with our family. However, she fits in it very tightly and I feel like squeezing two kids in there will be super uncomfortable. It's good for now. Very easy to fold up so I don't have to keep it open on my garage, I told it and put it against a wall (keep the tires on). I wish it didn't drop $15 in price the day after we got it though, super frustrating!!
customer_reviews.author: AJD

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely in love with this. This was given to me as a birthday gift and it has been such a delight. My children and I have been going on bike rides every night. My daughter loves riding in this. It attached easily to my bike so far functions wonderfully. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Works well but one big issue
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty light weight and folds up to store away very easily. The only thing I don't like is the seating position for my child which is very upright and uncomfortable. I have yet to find any way to adjust the seating position for my daughter. Like most young toddlers they will fall asleep eventually while on a ride and she keeps leaning too far forward over her legs which looks (and is) uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The tiny human loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for what it is. The baby wont be a baby for long and will soon be riding a bike so I didnt want to fork out hundreds for a trolly he was onky going to use a max of 2 summers. Its actually more rugged then i expected it took to the dirt road as well as the bije trails. Overall really impressed with it and wpuld reccomend to anyone wanting to tote their tot while riding.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfBoys

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for this Out of Shape mom
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to pull. I am totally out of shape and just recently decided to buy a bike and this trailer. I am very happy with it. The kids buckle in securely and I love the storage area in the back for water, my wallet and anything else i kmight need. The kids appreciate the cubbies inside the trailer for their water.
customer_reviews.author: Chubblette

customer_reviews.title: May need grinding to fit some frames
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the price. Easy to assemble/disassemble. Both tires have tread going in the same direction - need to flip tube on one of the tires. The coupler didn't set flush against my bike frame - was easy to grind some metal away and fun watching the sparks fly. Flag is loose, but has a loop so you can weigh it down with something similar to a weight on a fishing line.
customer_reviews.author: Lewie

customer_reviews.title: Love This Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is so great!!! I take my young kids out in it often. Some complications with install with my bike which my husband made work somehow. Wish I could share but I am not sure myself. From there this is easy to get on and off of my bike. Kids love it. It's stable. A nice way to get the kids outside and excersize with my kids safely riding along.
customer_reviews.author: YorkieLove

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Still working on how to fold it down. Using downtown (roadways) and works fine. This is my first trailer, and it was very easy to put together. My daughter is 65 lbs and average height, and sits in the middle comfortably (legs folded of course). We only use for short distances but have not had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: dap

customer_reviews.title: Tire popped
customer_reviews.text: The tubes that come with these tires are very weak. I pumped up to tire specifications but after reading online I should have done 10 pounds under that pressure indicated. This needs to be made more clear. We had to bike slowly over a mile to get back home with a flat tire. Everything was fine until this happened. Tires are disappointing everything else is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brock Stringham

customer_reviews.title: I use it for my Westie
customer_reviews.text: My sister's dog and my Westie like to travel the Pinellas Trail (Florida) sharing space in the trailer. I pull it with a 7 speed bike. It moves easily. Previously I had one of the same manufacture, but a little wider that finally wore out in the Florida humidity.
customer_reviews.author: HERBERT LAMBERTON

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly wheels make for an uncomfortable ride and bike damage concerns
customer_reviews.text: I give it 2 stars because customer service is great, and the cart looks great and useful. BUT i kept it at two stars because of the wheel. The wheels provided with the cart were not true, they wobble. I called and they promptly sent me another pair (great customer service) but the second pair are also wobbly! I dont know if its a quality issue or the fact that they are molded plastic and just cant be adjusted. It makes for a scary ride, as the cart wobbles badly and then im afraid of it damaging my bike's real wheel. Too bad, this was promising and i was excited to have it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made & easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: So much better than a child's seat on the back of the bike! If the floor was of a sturdier material (it's basically made of the same material as the sides & top), I would have given it 5 stars! Also love the fact that it seats 2 so it can accommodate a growing family! It also folds up for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. BrodaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: No zipper just Velcro so dogs must be complient..
customer_reviews.text: Use on my bike to take my smaller dogs to running areas and then tote them back home..this is for my small dog , and she is able to push out of the Velcro...
customer_reviews.author: Penny johnson

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to set up and its a smooth ride even with 2 small kids riding. You barely notice it's there for the bike rider. I love that it has space in the back to put items. You can fit quite a bit back there. It could use a little more leg room for my older daughter but 5 stars all around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed! My toddler loves it so much that I find him sitting in it all the time at home when we are not going for a ride. We have used it many times in the neighborhood and also went on a long adventure for many miles last week and we have had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Turner

product_meta.title: Instep Bike Trailer for Toddlers, Kids, Single and Double Seat, 2-In-1 Canopy Carrier, Multiple Colors
product_meta.description: Orange and Gray Double Bicycle Trailer
feature_bullets: 16” pneumatic tires with molded rims provide performance and style
Folding frame design with quick release wheel
2 in 1 canopy Includes a bug screen and weather shield
Versatile bicycle coupler attaches to most bicycles; Material: Rubber, Steel

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
